H0.text: Positive protons are the charge of the nucleus of an atom because they are present in the nucleus.

H1.text: Negative neutrons are the cause of the charge of the nucleus of an atom.

H2.text: Negative protons and positive electrons are what give the nucleus of an atom its charge.

H3.text: Positive protons and negative neutrons are the sources of the charge of the nucleus of an atom.

A4.text: Protons define the entire charge of a nucleus, and hence its chemical identity. Neutrons are electrically neutral...

A5.text: The neutron has a positively charged core of radius â‰ˆ 0.3 fm surrounded by a compensating negative charge of radius between 0.3 fm and 2 fm.
